statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Adonis Arms scored 21 points to lead Division II Northwest Nazarene to a 77-73 win over Idaho in the Vandal Holiday Hoops Showcase on Friday night.
article.headline: DII Northwest Nazarene takes down Idaho 77-73
article.linkText: DII Northwest Nazarene takes down Idaho 77-73
article.story: BOISE, Idaho -- Adonis Arms scored 21 points to lead Division II Northwest Nazarene to a 77-73 win over Idaho in the Vandal Holiday Hoops Showcase on Friday night. Northwest Nazarene University is located in Nampa, Idaho, 20 miles from Boise. Adalberto Diaz's jump shot with 9:43 left put the Crusaders ahead 54-52 and they never trailed again. Arms' jumper with 2:44 remaining made it 72-62. The Crusaders finished shooting 17 for 28 (60.7 percent) in the second half despite missing 13 free throws in the contest. Northwest Nazarene (5-0) took a 5-0 lead just a couple of minutes in. Olamilekan Adetunji made a 3-pointer and the Crusaders led 14-8 with 11:23 before halftime. Trevon Allen hit a jumper and a layup to break a 25-all tie for Idaho (1-3). Jared Rodriguez's jump shot made it 31-25 and the Vandals led 33-27 at the break. Obi Megwa scored 16 points for the Crusaders and Diaz scored 10. Allen led Idaho with 24 points and Cameron Tyson 19. The Crusaders will play Saturday against Portland State while the Vandals will face UC Santa Barbara.
